    About me

    Greetings!!

    I am Khan Md Hasib a first year PhD Student in the school of School of Systems and Computing at the University of New South Wales, Canberra. I am currently working in the Decision Support and Analytics Research Group (DSARG) at UNSW Canberra. At present, I am investigating bias, fairness and safety in the medical domain data.

    Prior to that I worked as an Assistant Professor at the Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Bangladesh University of Business and Technology (BUBT), Dhaka, Bangladesh. I also involved as a Lead Researcher at Advanced Machine Intelligence Research Lab (AMIRL). I have received my M.Sc. degree from the Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Brac University, Dhaka, Bangladesh. Additionally, I have completed my B.Sc. from the Department of Computer Science and Engineering, Ahsanullah University of Science & Technology (AUST), Dhaka, Bangladesh. My career aspiration is to work in leading AI research laboratories.

    I am open to any Research Collaborations in the field of Natural Language Processing, Health Informatcs and Computer Vision. For any inquiries or potential collaborations, please feel free to reach out via email.
